conclusion: Analyze the v-t graph to determine acceleration during 0 to 10 seconds.
The v-t graph shows a parabolic curve starting from the origin, reaching maximum velocity at 10 seconds, then decreasing linearly to zero at 15 seconds.
Graph starts at origin indicating initial velocity of zero.
From 0 to 10 seconds, the graph is a straight line with a positive slope.
A positive slope on a v-t graph indicates an increase in velocity, corresponding to acceleration.
Since the slope is positive, the acceleration is upward.
From 10 to 15 seconds, the graph shows a negative slope, indicating a decrease in velocity and downward acceleration.
During the 0 to 10 seconds interval, the acceleration is upward.
